results.content: I’ve amended my original review from 1.5 stars where I feel I was now a bit harsh and put this up to a 3.5 star review due to taking another course and now understanding more about what the instructor is trying to achieve in his teachings. I can’t recommend this course to a complete beginner as I feel you will get lost in his style of teaching just like I originally did, however knowing more about laravel and coming back to this course it actually holds a lot of value in the project work even if slightly under structured sac course, so yes if you do know a fair bit of laravel then this course is fairly decent. The instructors native language is clearly not English so be prepared to rewind and listen again to many parts but this is not his fault at all. Over all of you are looking at making a project in laravel and want to see how someone else builds one this is a fair course but please don’t come at it with no real prior knowledge or you may end up frustrated. I still don’t enjoy taking an already made theme template and cobbling a ui together from it id much prefer the tutor to code these as part of the course. There’s lots of good and a little bit of bad but if you get the course at a good price it’s worth a purchase.

The instructors native language is clearly not English so be prepared to rewind and listen again to many parts but this is not his fault at all. results.content:
This is a great course for everyone who wants to master laravel. The explanation by the trainer is comprehensive and step by step.
As a intermediate level developer I was always wondering how to make real world applications. I am in just section 3, but I am enjoying this course so much as it is practical course.
Thanks for this course!
